summary: This appears to be a fragment of email correspondence regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on July 26, 2019, discussing the provision of medication ('self carry') to him. The date is significant as it is the day before Epstein's death.

events.title: Medication provision to Epstein
events.description: Correspondence indicates that inmate Jeffrey Epstein was being given medication on a 'self carry' basis instead of a multi-day supply at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations.description: Metropolitan Correctional Center, a federal detention facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held.

keyFacts: The document is dated July 26, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It references the provision of medication to Epstein on a 'self carry' basis at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
The correspondence involves the U.S. Department of Justice and Federal Bureau of Prisons.
The fragmented nature suggests it may be part of internal email discussions about Epstein's care or supervision.
